items.name: Flayer Hound
items.description: The Flayer Tribe is a threat that most associate with roads and wildlands. But occasionally, their gaze turns to a settlement. While raiding, they often don’t need to bare their blades at all. They sic their warhounds on the unsuspecting civilians, watch them ravage and rip their way through the community, before coming in for the killing blow once they’re bored of the fun.

items.name: Emberstead Regalia
items.description: The United Republic of Mankind is known as a relentless conqueror, and none were so entirely consumed by their expansion as the dissolved Kingdom of Alia. Emberstead, a frontier city of Alia, is rumoured to have conducted a nigh-suicidal campaign to resist Republican incursion. None know for sure, for by the end, all traces of their heraldry and history were erased: only this single armour piece remains.

items.name: Timefault Tracker
items.description: The Cult of Infinity shapes and bends time thanks to their worship of the Fallen Primordial Anulai-Taï. This allows for unusual tactics when it comes to breeding animals: their dogs have an accelerated metabolism which allows them to grow strong and grow fast, along with an ability to track cracks and faults in the Weave of Time.

items.name: Minotaur Plate
items.description: There is a distant archipelago called Baktoraï, where seven sisters lived in Summerwind Mansion. They remained young and beautiful for far longer than good health could account for. A strange brute in their employ procured them with girls of which they drank the youth. His face hidden under a horned helmet, he’d drag victims by the hair through the manor doors, bellowing like an animal through the abduction.

items.name: Aberrant Dog
items.description: This is not a dog. Though it may bark, lay its front paws on your lap, and ask for all the attention a dog might, take heed: this is no canine friend. The Cult of the Aberrant took a mass of shapeless flesh, and reshaped it in order to infiltrate wild dog colonies and spread Ashtaroth’s corruption. The illusion isn’t perfect, but good enough that the creature itself appears to be fooled. It seems, indeed, to believe that it is a dog. Perhaps that’s all that matters.

items.name: Perennial Wolf
items.description: The cold and windy nation of Varg once had a beloved Queen, known to be carted across nations with a procession of fearsome and elegant wolves. This breed, which she called “Perennial Wolf” for its longevity and loyalty, was gifted to the royal families of both Kuei and Laibon, binding the alliance between the three crowns tighter than ever.

items.name: Firebarker
items.description: Sacrifices to Abanazaar are sober events: one must give the Fallen Lord of Envy what he is owed, after all. And yet, when a mongrel was walking by the shrine, she ate of the scorched flesh consecrated to the Fallen. By consuming the Faith imbued in the meat, she usurped a portion of the Fallen’s power over fire.

items.name: Emancipator Apparel
items.description: The flying city of Archion is a near perfect prison: escape means falling to your death, unless the town happens to be anchored to the ground. The gladiator Antithian was celebrated for his skill and granted the right to free movement within the city. He used his fame and privilege to entertain the guards securing the anchor chains, allowing hundreds of slaves to evacuate. Antithian was executed for his rebellion, and no such privileges were ever given to an Archion gladiator again.

items.name: Vargian Ghost-Wolf
items.description: The nation of Varg is headless: its Queen was found dead, frozen solid within her own palace, with all her servants reaching out to her, immobilized in their final moments. A messenger discovered the palace in this state, and later claimed he saw a ghostly white wolf on the nearby hills. Could it have been the Queen’s soul, taking the form of one of her beloved pets?

items.name: Time-Devourer Wolf
items.description: The Cult of Infinity hunts for weak points in the Weave of Time in order to increase their control over it. The hounds and wolves from their Timefault Tracker breeding program are trained to sniff out cracks in the weave, places where reality is a little more susceptible to manipulation. This attraction to aethereal imperfections infuses the wolves with an unpredictable energy.
